result.execSummary:
The defendant Markus S Kroeplin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Marathon County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: GFE to obtain/maintain FTE/schooling or combination thereof, or any time he does not meet that requirement, defendant must complete 10 hours of community service per week.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

Any assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by PO.  DNA sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: all unpaid costs converted to civil judgment

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Clerk: Amy. 
Case called: 2:41 p.m.  
INCLUDES 16CF196, 16CF1322, 16CM159, 19CF573 and 20CF1241.
State appears by ADA Natalie Zibolski via zoom video.  Defendant appears from MCJ w/Attorney Tina Abernethy-Mays via zoom video. 
Date and time set for SAR hearing in 16CM159, 16CF196 and 16CF1322; VRCW. 

ADA Zibolski makes statement re: sentencing for revocation. 
Atty Tina Abernethy-Mays makes statement.  
COURT makes the following findings: 

16CF1322>>
Count 3 (4th Degree Sexual Assault):  9 months MCJ; concurrent with each other.
Count 4 (Exposing Genitals/Pubic Area/Intimate Parts): 9 month MCJ. 
COURT converts all unpaid court costs to civil judgment.  
COURT grants 230 days credit. 

16CM159>>
Count 1 (Possession of THC): 6 months MCJ; concurrent with each other. 
COURT converts all unpaid court costs to civil judgment. 
COURT grants 160 days credit. 

16CF196>> 
Count 2 (Theft-Movable Property): 9 months MCJ; concurrent with each other.
Count 3 (CDTP): 9 months MCJ. 
Count 4 (Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor): 9 months MCJ. 
COURT converts all unpaid court costs to civil judgment. 
COURT grants 206 days credit.

State moves to revoke DEOJ in 16CF196 Count 1 (Burglary-Building or Dwelling) and 16CF1322 Count 1 (3rd Degree Sexual Assault); COURT GRANTS.  
COURT orders PSI to be completed within 45 days.  
Parties requesting argued sentence. 
COURT sets calendar call for 4/22/21 at 1:00 p.m. to set argued sentence; all other cases tracking.  

Adj:  3:03 p.m.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial conference on February 10, 2021 at 09:10 am.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations
Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk Cheree
Cases 1CF196 and 16CM159 called: 1:28pm
State appears by ADA C.Minder.  Def appears in person/in custody and with Atty Abernethy-Mays  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW; Written DEJ agreement filed.


PLEA:
16CM159 - Ct. 1 (Poss THC/PTAC)>>NO CONTEST
16CF196 - Ct. 1 (Burglary)>>NO CONTEST
16CF196 - Ct. 2 (Theft)>>NO CONTEST
16CF196 - Ct. 3 (CDTP)>>NO CONTEST
16CF196 - Ct. 4 (Misd BJ)>>NO CONTEST

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty on Misd counts ONLY.

COURT ORDERS: On Misd counts>>Sentence W/held on each count; 2 years probation on each count, concurrent to each other.
CONDITIONS: Any assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by PO; Absolute sobriety; GFE to obtain/maintain FTE/FT schooling or combination thereof, or any time he does not meet that requirement, defendant must complete 10 hours of C.S. per week; CC; DNA sample and surcharge on each count.

On Ct. 1 in 16CF196>>  COURT w/holds finding and entry of guilt - COURT adopts written deferred entry of judgment agreement as signed by all parties and submitted to COURT.
COURT defers matter for a period of 2 years for defendant to comply with all terms and conditions of written DEJ agreement.
If defendant is in full compliance with all terms and conditions of written DEJ agreement within that time frame and obtains no new criminal charges, State to DISMISS Ct. 1 in 16CF196

DEOJ RH>> 4/16/18 at 8:30am
Bond continues on that count.

Adj: 1:38pm

Clerk Cheree
Cases 16CM159 and 16CF196 Called: 9:10am
State appears by ADA C.Minder; Deft appears in person/pro se with Atty Tina Abernethy-Mays
(Prelim in 16CF196)
Waiver of Prelim. filed in 16CF196.
  
Court questions deft as to waiver.
Court finds waiver freely and voluntarily made.
COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial.  
Information filed.  Reading Waived. R/J
Plea:  NOT GUILTY
Dates to be set on both files (Misd has FPT/JT set) -- PTC to be set for both cases together
State notes discovery will be sent this week on felony file
Bond:  Continued


Adj: 9:14am

No contact with victim(s):  L.G. and T.S. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.  Absolute sobriety from controlled substances.
